bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: ① Illness Sign identical with huan 緩①， slackening . Qian jin bei ji fang 千金備急方 8: 石南湯，治六十四種 風，注走入皮膚中如蟲行，腰脊強直，五緩六急，手足拘攣 , “Decoction with shi nan [leaves]: It cures the 64 types of wind flowing into the skin and creating a sensation of crawling insects there. The lumbar region and back are stiff and straight. The five types of slackening and the six types of tension [will result]. The hands and feet cramp and contract”.

② Pathological Condition with slackening. Shen nong ben cao jing 神農本草經 Substance Entry gan qi 乾漆：安五藏，五緩六急，風寒濕痹 , “It serves to pacify the five depots, the five types of slackening and the six types of tension, as well as wind cold moisture blockage”.
